reviews.sentence: Good for a short stay. Considering the price this was a good place to stay. Its a little old and has been slightly remodeled. Really nothing to complain about just nothing above average. The staff was very friendly and everything seemed clean except the side stairwell which had a very weird smell. Good for a short stay.
Good. Bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very dated definitely in need of a remodel.

Reviews do not do it justice. I booked this hotel through Priceline bidding so I clearly got an amazing rate. I was not expecting much due to the reviews here on TripAdvisor. I do not know what hotel these people stayed at but it could not have been this one. I came to check in around 730pm and noticed balconies when we pulled up. I went to the front desk and asked the agent if all rooms came with a balcony and she said no but I can get you in one if you had like. Uh YES PLEASE. Super accommodating Front Desk. I thought we could smoke on the balconies but you can not we walked down to the Courtyard. No bigie. Got to the room and it was very pretty. I love the colors in the room not like other hotels that are flat. Very clean. Checked the shower for hair none. Towels none. Bathroom floor none. Bed none. Very very clean room. Bed was a tad hard for my personal preference but my husband LOVED it. Towels were super soft. The whole hotel was very clean and staff was very accommodating. Security Front Desk Maintenance and the bistro attendant were always greeting you every time you walked by. The only thing that bothered me about this whole hotel were the signs that said renos were coming in Q4 2017. I loved the hotel and I do not think it requires any renos.
Location. First room smelled of cigarettes and after we requested another room that toilet was backed up. Rooms needs updating.

I can not say that I am satisfied enough with this hotel. First the good. The hotel is relatively clean and in a good location within Baton Rouge near the interstate and plenty of shopping and entertainment. The beds are pretty comfortable. I did not try the food. On the other side of things the property is fairly old and its age is showing everywhere you look. It is in need of a deep renovation from top to bottom. The noise from Interstate 10 through these very old windows is probably maddening after an extended stay. do not expect peace and quiet because its very noisy here. The bathtub is tiny and the interior is cracking. The A C unit is ancient loud and basic. The amenity areas seem decent in terms of the bar pool and very small fitness center. I will not stay here again.
Location and staff. Condition of bathtub needs resurfacing and repair towels were not white looked very dingy.

Waste of money. As a businessman I have come to expect a certain level out of Courtyard Mariot. This property fails at almost every level from customer service to the room I stayed in which was disgusting. What kills me is I paid extra as I had to do some late night business and wanted a larger room with a desk. The first thing I noticed is the chair at the desk is completely falling apart. As I did not have a lot of time for changing rooms I toughed it out. The next morning was no better the bathroom was atrocious. The water pressure non existent out of the shower and the shower and associated parts were completely falling apart. That morning when I checked out I complained to the front desk stating I would not rent this room to anybody before serious maintenance was performed on the room. The gentleman at the front desk said sorry about that handed me my receipt and that was it. I will not be back and I would suggest others avoid this place like the plague.

It is a older remodeled Courtyard. The lobby is starting to show its age. The rooms are standard and comfortable just also showing their use. On the plus side there are plenty of restaurants near by so you are not at their mercy. If you need a Mariot product in. Baton Rouge this is a solid choice.

it is 645 AM time for everyone to get up. My initial impression was positive. The staff was friendly. However they checked someone in on my reservation causing my room to change. The staff handled the administrative portion on the mistake with ease. Unfortunately the room change put me into a room on the 3rs floor and roof repairs started promptly at 645 AM. The staff was apathetic at best. No one cared or offered an apology. Staff simply stated the hotel is undergoing renovations. Had I known I would booked the hotel next door.

Great Stay. ✨. Over all it was great there was a lot of unsupervised children running around but it was an hotel. I had like to see a little more activity from the workers there. Maybe there hands were tied on some issues but with the remodel stress could have been an issues as well. We Had A Boat Load of Fun.

Enjoyable stay. The bed was extremely comfortable and room was absolutely beautiful and looked as it were newly renovated. But the primary reason that I keep returning to this hotel is the amazing staff who are always so kind courteous and helpful at every visit and that makes it so easy for me to choose this place every time that I ’m in Baton Rouge.
Friendly staff updated clean rooms reasonable rates. Will stay here again.
Happy I got a renovated room.
Remodeled great stafclean rooms.
Staff was very friendly pool was clean rooms were clean only thing was the hot tub needs to be updated.

Very Friendly. My wife and I stayed at the Mariot courtyard last weekend. A very pleasant experience. The staff is outstanding. Every one we met was extremely friendly. We had a great meal at the restaurant. The hotel had just been remodeled so it looks top notch. recommend to anyone who is looking to stay in the Baton Rouge area.

Great Mariot property. First time here since remodeling. This is great lodging for Baton Rouge. Even the breakfast was good. eggs fried the way I requested crisp bacon hash browns. Accommodations were comfortable and quiet. Set a standard for Baton Rouge in my book. albeit a little away from LSU and downtown. Maybe that is what made it so good.

Awesome hotel that is been renovated and modernized so some of the pictures are deceptive of what it actually is. The lounge is great and is a great spot to enjoy breakfast andor work from your laptop. it is in a fantastic location with restaurants Top Golf and known stores right off of I10.

Walking. The hotel was very nice and updated. I loved the seating areas in the lounge. The only thing I did n’t like was that the description said there was a indoor and outdoor pool. But the outdoor pool was across the street. My family and I had to walk across the street in our swimwear. I was not comfortable with that. But the hotel was nice. We will definitely use them again.

Great hotel for adults and kids. Hotel us updated with a great look and amenities are well kept. Cleanliness gets an A. Love Mary Cordelia and Latoya and i enjoyed Lashaun the operational manager. Everyone was nice and not just doing their job nice. They made me feel like I was home away from home. Thanks Mariot staff for making my visit extraordinary.
